p: The clinical features overlap significantly with encephalitis, but in essence encephalitis is predominantly a grey matter problem as a result of the cytopathic effect on the cell bodies in the cortex, basal ganglia and thalami, presenting with a change in the sensorium and with seizures, as opposed to ADEM, which is primarily a white matter disease. Features of white matter disease or demyelination are spasticity, optic neuritis and/or atrophy, ataxia, neuropathy, myelopathy and occasionally seizures; the sensorium is affected to a lesser extent [ 4, 14].
